G4969-d-12-16-00-WC.Narrative: CAR, TR 401110, WAS SPOTTED ON HYDRITE INDUSTRY STORAGE TRACK ON DECEMBER 8TH.  ON DECEMBER 16TH, APASSERBY REPORTED THAT A BURNING OR SMOLDERING CAR WAS ON THE TRACK NEAR THE HYDRITE CHEMICAL PLANT.INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT TR 401110 HAD SMOKE AND DUST MATERIAL BILLOWING FROM THE SIDES OF THE CAR.  A BLUE FLAME WAS ALSO NOTED TO BE COMING FROM THE CAR.  THE AREA WAS EVACUATEDAND HAZARDOUS MATERIAL TEAMS TOOK OVER THE INCIDENT.  THE STRING OF 10 CARS WERE PULLED UP TO A RAIL-HIGHWAY CROSSING TO ALLOW EASE IN GETTING AT THE BURNING CAR.  THE CAR WAS EVENTUALLY EXTINGUISHEDAND UNLOADED, ALL EVACUEES WERE RETURNED TO THEIR HOMES.  IT WAS REPORTED THAT 8 PEOPLE WERE TREATEDAND RELEASED AT THE LOCAL HOSPITAL FOR INHALATION OF FUMES.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

162808-d-12-20-00-SOO.Narrative: DURING AUTOMATIC HUMP OPERATIONS, EMPTY SYRUP TANK CAR PRGX 10226 DESTINED TO TRACK C23 TRACK CORNERED EMPTY SYRUP TANK CAR CRGX 19551  ROOT CAUSE & RECOMMENDED CORRECTIVE ACTION(S) - FAILURE OF PROYARD AUTOMATIC HUMP COMPUTER PROGRAM TO PROVIDE FOUL PROTECTION FOR FOLLOWING CAR.  RESPONSIBILITY FORIMPLEMENTING RECOMMENDATION:  LOCAL SIGNALS AND COMMUNICATION SUPERVISOR CONTACTED PROYARD PROGRAMMER TO ACCESS LOCAL COMPUTER PROGRAM TO INVESTIGATE PROGRAM FAILURE AND REPAIR PROGRAMING MALFUNCTIONIMMEDIATELY. RECOMMENDED CORRECTIVE ACTION # 1:  PROYARD PROGRAMER TO REVIEW THE INCIDENT AND CORRECT COMPUTER PROGRAM MALFUNCTION.  RECOMMENDED CORRECTIVE ACTION # 2: PROYARD PROGRAM SHOULD BE SCANNED PERIODICALLY TO ENABLE DETECTION AND CORRECTION OF ANY POSSIBLE PROGRAM ERRORS.  THIS SHOULD ALSO HELP ELIMINATE THE POSSIBILITY OF A BUILDUP OF "GLITCHES" IN THE PROGRAM.  RESPONSIBILITY FOR IMPLEMENTING RECOMMENDATION/BY WHEN:  LOCAL S&C SUPERVISOR, IMMEDIATENoneNoneNone

162662-d-12-11-00-SOO.Accident Cause: Failure to allow air brakes to fully release before proceeding (H005)
162662-d-12-11-00-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 425-10'S CREW CUT OFF TRAIN ON WEST END OF C43 TRACK.  ASSIGNMENT 4726 (2230 FORD HAULER) TIEDONTO TRAIN, PUMPED AIR FOR ABOUT TEN MINUTES, ATTEMPTED TO PULL AND WAS UNABLE.  CREW BACKED TRAINUP ABOUT ONE CAR LENGTH AND THEN BEGAN TO PULL, MOVED ABOUT ONE AND ONE-HALF CARS WHEN AIR WENT INTOEMERGENCY.  FOREMAN WALKED BACK AND DISCOVERED DRAWBAR PULLED OUT OF 27TH CAR, CR 295811, LOAD.  ROOT CAUSE OF INCIDENT:  FAILURE TO ALLOW AMPLE TIME FOR AIR BRAKE SYSTEM TO FULLY CHARGE AND FULLY RELEASE BEFORE MOVING TRAIN. FAILURE TO STRETCH SLACK BEFORE INCREASING NOTCHES ON THROTTLE.  RECOMMENDED CORRECTIVE ACTION # 1:  REVIEW OF CORRECT PROCEDURES TO CHARGE, RELEASE AND ATTEMPT TO MOVE TRAIN.  RECOMMENDED CORRECTIVE ACTION # 2:  ROAD FOREMAN RIDE WITH, AND OBSERVE TRAIN OPERATING PROCEDURES AND COACH AS NECESSARY.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

162725-d-12-18-00-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 614-087, UNITS CP 8576/8506 PULLING 102 LOADS, NO EMPTIES, 13,719 ETT, TRAVELING EAST OVER SINGLE MAIN TRACKAGE,  WHEN TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY APPLICATION.  UPON INSPECTION, CREW FOUND DERAILED CARS, TOTAL OF 28 AS DETERMINED BY MS DEPARTMENT, ALL CARS ON THEIR SIDES WITH THE EXCEPTION OF TWO CARS.  LEADING FIRST CAR WHICH DERAILED, 7TH CAR BEHIND ENGINE, UTLX 801045 FOUND UPRIGHT WITH BROKEN WHEEL.  THE REAR CAR, UTLX 78107 WAS FOUND ALSO DERAILED IN AN UPRIGHT POSITION.
